title: feature_names parameter in summary_plots
body:
I expected that when I would use 'feature_names' in summary_plots() I would restrict the plot only to the feature_names I specified. Is it incorrect expectation?

Example:
I expect a plot only for two features.
```
import pandas as pd
import numpy as np
import lightgbm as lgb
from sklearn import datasets
iris = datasets.load_iris()
data = pd.DataFrame(data= np.c_[iris['data'], iris['target']],
                     columns = iris['feature_names'] + ['target'])
y = data.target
X = data.drop('target', axis=1)  # we only take the first two features.
clf = lgb.LGBMClassifier()
clf.fit(X, y)

explainer = shap.TreeExplainer(clf)
shap_values = explainer.shap_values(X)
shap.summary_plot(shap_values, X, feature_names = ['sepal length (cm)', 'sepal width (cm)'])
```

throws following error:
```
---------------------------------------------------------------------------
IndexError                                Traceback (most recent call last)
<ipython-input-43-97ff0bab767e> in <module>()
     10 explainer = shap.TreeExplainer(clf)
     11 shap_values = explainer.shap_values(X)
---> 12 shap.summary_plot(shap_values, X, feature_names = ['sepal length (cm)', 'sepal width (cm)'])

~/anaconda3/lib/python3.6/site-packages/shap/plots/summary.py in summary_plot(shap_values, features, feature_names, max_display, plot_type, color, axis_color, title, alpha, show, sort, color_bar, auto_size_plot, layered_violin_max_num_bins, class_names)
    355             left_pos += global_shap_values[feature_inds]
    356         pl.yticks(y_pos, fontsize=13)
--> 357         pl.gca().set_yticklabels([feature_names[i] for i in feature_inds])
    358         pl.legend(frameon=False, fontsize=12)
    359 

~/anaconda3/lib/python3.6/site-packages/shap/plots/summary.py in <listcomp>(.0)
    355             left_pos += global_shap_values[feature_inds]
    356         pl.yticks(y_pos, fontsize=13)
--> 357         pl.gca().set_yticklabels([feature_names[i] for i in feature_inds])
    358         pl.legend(frameon=False, fontsize=12)
    359 

IndexError: list index out of range
```
